quotes: Yudhoyono became a mortar platoon commander in 1977
an operations officer for an airborne brigade from 1977 to 1978
a company commander at Kostrad from 1979 to 1981
Yudhoyono then spent 1981 and 1982 working at the Army headquarters
When Yudhoyono returned in 1983, he was made commander of the Infantry Trainers' School
In 1985, Yudhoyono also took a Battalion Commando Course in Malaysia
From 1986 to 1988, Yudhoyono served with Kodam IX/Udayana
Yudhoyono was a battalion commander from 1986 to 1988
Yudhoyono was part of the operational staff in 1988
In 1989, Yudhoyono became a lecturer at the Army Staff College (Seskoad)
he took the opportunity to obtain an MA degree in business management from Webster University in 1991
In 1992, Yudhoyono was transferred to the Army Information Department
In 1993, when Edi became commander of the Military of Indonesia (ABRI), Yudhoyono joined Edi's personal staff

quotes: before taking command IV/Diponegoro Military Area Command in Central Java
From East Timor, Yudhoyono became a mortar platoon commander in 1977
While working at the Army headquarters, Yudhoyono was sent to the United States again
at Fort Benning and in training with the 82nd Airborne Division
Yudhoyono also spent time in Panama and went through the jungle warfare school
this time to Belgium and West Germany, to undertake the Antitank weapons Course
this time to Belgium and West Germany, to undertake the Antitank weapons Course
In 1985, Yudhoyono also took a Battalion Commando Course in Malaysia
which covers Bali and the Lesser Sunda Islands
which covers Bali and the Lesser Sunda Islands
at Fort Leavenworth, Kansas
before taking command IV/Diponegoro Military Area Command in Central Java
